caption.center: Martha Ehrenwerth, Executrix, Appellee, v. Carrie Moog, Appellant.

court.center: Appellate Court of Illinois, Second District.

date.center: Rehearing denied and additional opinion filed November 15, 1939.

opinion.syllabus:
EXECUTIONS, § 96[fn*] — body execution, when properly issued. Body execution was properly issued in action for fraudulent conversion of personal property, where summons was served after death of original plaintiff and before substitution of executrix and defendant voluntarily appeared thereafter; the right of action survived, and neither demand nor application for writ supported by affidavit was necessary in case of malicious fraud.
[fn*] See Callaghan's Illinois Digest, same topic and section number.
opinion.posture: Appeal from Circuit Court of Cook county; Hon. STANLEY H. KLARKOWSKI, presiding. Affirmed. Heard in second division, first district, at April term, 1939; opinion filed October 31, 1939; rehearing denied and additional opinion filed November 15, 1939.
